item.title: 19 Best Survival Horror Games Of All Time, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Survival horror games rely on more than jump scares, pitting a (usually) rather helpless protagonist against an overwhelming evil.
  • Throughout the years, many near-genre-defining survival horror titles have been released, from Silent Hill 2 to Amnesia: The Dark Descent.
  • The following games remain the greatest pillars of survival horror, with some of the eeriest atmospheres and thrilling gameplay.

A good survival horror game is often a mixture of good stories and bone-chilling moments. It doesn't rely only on cheap jumpscares but develops interesting and terrifying monsters that hunt down the main character. With horror being such a big franchise, it's not often that people see an excellent title put out on the market. That being said, if players are survival horror fanatics and are looking to play something new, there are many candidates who more than fit the bill in this regard.

Many games have left a lasting impression in the genre in the past years and will continue to define survival horror for decades to come. Whether it's because of their intense resource management, tense combat, nerve-wracking story, or a combination of all three, there's no denying that the best survival horror games around let players experience a feeling that makes every small victory as satisfying as can be while trying to deal with a wealth of horrifying humans and monsters.

Updated on August 18, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: The survival experience in games is usually coupled with the fear of running out of resources, which already makes it a horrifying adventure, but some games take one step further and offer even more horror elements through environment and storytelling.

While most survival horror games are linear experiences with an extra focus on the story and narrative, there have been some great open-world games in the same genre as well in the past years, which allow players to use their creativity in overcoming the challenges and terrors of creepy worlds.

19 Barotrauma

Surviving In Space With A Submarine

Unlike most other horror games that try to imply fear with jumpscares or eerie sounds, Barotruama creates a heavily dark environment in deep space, where the player's only hope for survival is their submarine, but as long as it operates properly.

Playable in solo and co-op modes, Barotrauma tasks players with operating the submarine under any condition, while facing space monsters and challenging situations. Players will always need to deal with the fear of losing the submarine, which is why they have to master their skills in managing the resources and fixing the submarine's problem one by one, before they are exposed to mutated creatures.

18 Phasmophobia

A Realistic Fear Of Unknown

Thanks to its VR support, Phosmophobia is an ultimate experience for anyone who wants to feel the sense of fear deep within. Similar to Barotrauma , Phsamophobia also supports online co-op mode, which allows players to explore the horrific world of the game together!

Phasmophbia revolves around hunting ghosts with a theme similar to The Exorcist movie. Players are ghost hunters, and they need to use all the tools and devices at their disposal to find the source of paranormal activity, but it is not going to be easy to face these otherworldly beings.

17 The Forest

Surviving The Cannibal Tribe

Both The Forest and its sequel, Sons of the Forest , deliver a superb survival experience on an open-world island, where players can build their own bases, though it is not about living a happy life there! Both games follow a crash onto an unknown island, where life looks much different from the rest of the world.

The survival elements are quite bold in The Forest series, as players need to find food and water, craft weapons, and build safe bases where they could rest for a single night at least. However, the island is inhabited by a cannibal tribe, who will raid players at night. Exploring The Forest's world during nighttime and sneaking inside caves full of cannibals could be among every gamer's most horrifying experiences ever.

16 STALKER

Revisiting The Post-Apocalyptic Chernobyl

Similar to Barotrauma , the STALKER series also tries to imply fear by creating a realistic world where access to resources is limited and people struggle to survive. While this game is more action-oriented than most other games on this list, players still feel the horror in the post-apocalyptic world of STALKER .

After a nuclear catastrophe, all radiation-infected zones are locked down, but there are still bandit groups smuggling cargo in and out of the zone. The player, however, is looking for someone special inside the radiation zone, and this journey, will force them to deal with many horrifying situations.

15 Haunting Ground

Escape From An Eerie Castle

Haunting Ground is easily one of the most underappreciated survival horror games of all time, channeling the pursuit energy of Clock Tower with a fresh coat of paint that makes this title such an unnerving experience from start to end. Fiona is a pretty engaging protagonist, even if her use as fanservice can be rather harrowing to watch given the gruesome subject matter of this game.

Thankfully, players aren't completely alone as they deal with the many pursuers who are trying to chase her down for their nefarious purposes. They have a dog called Hewie who aids Fiona every step of the way, allowing her to secure some much-needed items and have some sort of protection against her pursuers whenever Hewie tries to protect her by biting her enemies.

14 The Evil Within

Unraveling A Dark Story In A World Of Terrors

While many horror games today opt for a first-person perspective, The Evil Within is a throwback to the days when games like Resident Evil and Silent Hill dominated with their classic third-person perspective. The Evil Within puts us in the shoes of a detective who's desperately trying to solve a mass murder.

During his investigation, he's transported into an otherworldly place filled with terrifying monsters. With the original creator of the Resident Evil series as one of the primary developers, players can expect a haunting survival story full of horrors and scares.

13 Until Dawn

Tough Decisions And Harsh Consequences

For those who love shaping their own story, Until Dawn is one of the greatest survival horror games. It's set up like a classic slasher horror film, where multiple characters must try to survive the horrors that haunt them. As players control numerous characters in different scenes, they'll need to collect clues to help them move forward.

Sometimes, players will make decisions and find items that will affect the future, providing them with a brief vision of the future. This will help them make the right choices when the time is right. Players should keep in mind that, for everyone to survive, every detail must fall perfectly in place.

12 The Last Of Us

Feeling The Brutality Of A Lawless World

There's no question that The Last Of Us is one of the best games of the last twenty years. While it would take forever to elaborate why, it's better to experience the game firsthand. If players haven't already ventured into the zombie apocalypse as Joel and Ellie, then it's strongly recommended that they get around to it.

The Last Of Us series is a mix of fluid gameplay, which includes both combat and stealth options. The threat of the enemies feels real, and with Ellie by their side, the stakes are higher than ever. Even years after, the graphics look amazing and the story will move even the toughest ones to tears.

11 Alien: Isolation

An Original Story Following The Events Of The Alien

There's no horror movie quite like the original Alien , which is why Alien: Isolation became such a popular title. Its aesthetics are inspired by the first movie, and the game transports us back to a time shortly after the Nostromo's fall when Amanda Ripley is struggling to find out what happened to her mother.

As she ends up stranded in a space station that has been taken over by hostile synthetics and the Xenomorphs themselves, she must fight for her survival against the perfect organism itself. With beautiful sound design, immersive gameplay, and a challenging & intelligent alien AI to flee, this game provides many fun moments and nerve-wracking scares for hours on end.

10 Outlast

Escaping A Never-Ending Nightmare

When Outlast first came out, it became one of the scariest games of its time. When an investigative journalist arrives at an abandoned mental hospital while hunting for a big scoop, he becomes trapped in the facility and is faced with its deranged inhabitants.

Outlast is one of those games that plays perfectly with a first-person perspective. With the camera function that helps them see in the dark, the game effectively pairs found footage horror movies with the survival horror genre perfectly, creating a chill-inducing and gore-filled experience.

9 Darkwood

Masterful Balance Between Survival Gameplay And Horror Elements

Most people would assume that the top-down perspective instantly takes away from the horror of most games. However, these people have not played Darkwood , which uses this viewpoint to great effect.

The limited cone of vision makes players jumpy with every creepy sound, and the atmosphere of this game is sublime. The fact that this game touches on Lovecraftian themes, despite the creator not even knowing of this form of horror, is a testament to just how effective its horror is.

8 Condemned: Criminal Origins

Investigating The Nest Of Serial Killers

Combining the horror of fighting unhinged individuals with some excellent first-person melee combat, it's downright criminal that more people don't talk about Condemned: Criminal Origins . The game is easily one of the most underrated survival horror games around, with its disturbing visuals being pretty tough to stomach.

Controlling an FBI agent who is trying to discover the source of the mysterious killings that have been taking place in the city of Metro makes for a great time as players slowly uncover the depths of a truly nightmarish controversy. It doesn't help that the protagonist, Ethan Thomas, is framed for these murders, causing him to battle friend and foe alike in a bid to reach the truth and clear his name in the process.

7 SOMA

A Deep, Depressing Story Hidden Beneath The Ocean

When Simon goes for a brain scan after a car accident, he suddenly finds himself transported into PATHOS-II, an underwater research base at the bottom of the ocean. Overrun by strange robotic creatures that seem to have a will of their own, Simon needs to find a way out of the derelict facility that threatens to burst at its seams.

SOMA is a typical survival horror in the sense that players get no weapons to help them on their way. Stealth and wits will get them far against even the most ferocious and fast-moving enemies. The game is extremely imaginative in its aesthetics, and its story is guaranteed to leave players feeling emotional and in awe of just how brilliant the writing is.

6 Amnesia: The Dark Descent

A Classic Survival Horror To Define Fear

Many survival horror games take place in the future, but Amnesia: The Dark Descent went a vastly different route. In the 1830s, Daniel wakes up with severe amnesia inside a castle he hardly remembers getting himself into. Hunted down by terrifying monsters, he needs to find a way to remember the past.

This game was a massive success upon its release, due to its incredible stealth and sanity mechanics, which would force players to be sparing with their lantern oil. Moreover, it had one of the most complex and interesting storylines, which combined historical themes with science fiction.

5 Resident Evil Series

Surviving A Doomed House In The Middle Of Nowhere

After languishing in mediocrity for some time since Resident Evil 5 , fans of the series were finally graced with a brand-new direction for the series that focused on a first-person perspective and tackled new and fresh events. The end result was Resident Evil 7: Biohazard , which is as harrowing as most players would assume as they step into the shoes of Ethan Winters and try to bring her wife back after things go south.

Not only did the series manage to bring back the brutality of a zombie apocalypse with Ethan's storyline, but it also achieved even greater success by remaking older fan-favorite entries, adding more survival-horror flavor to them with the new tech. Resident Evil 4 Remake is a great example of how the survival horror genre can tell deep stories while featuring solid gameplay mechanics.

4 Dead Space

Facing Unprecedented Terrors In Deep Space

This list wouldn't be complete without the predecessor to most modern sci-fi survival horror titles: Dead Space . Isaac Clarke is tasked with investigating a mining ship that has been taken over by horrible monsters known as Necromorphs. Through various clues, he eventually discovers the truth behind the ship's fate.

Many games have tried to do what Dead Space accomplished with sci-fi horror but in vain. With a wide arsenal of weapons, it's one of the more action-heavy survival horror games, but its incredible design and popularity are undeniable. The remake does a great job of making this title more detailed, visually astounding, and horrifying in its own right. The fact that Isaac finally speaks is a bonus too.

3 Silent Hill 2

A Classic Psychological Horror

When James Sunderland receives a message from his missing wife to meet him in the town of Silent Hill, he leaves off to the mysterious town immediately. However, as he arrives, he's faced with an array of zombie-like monsters and other apparitions that look straight out of his worst nightmares.

The Silent Hill franchise is a master of survival horror, and this installment of the series proves it. James' story is not only incredibly emotional, but full of iconic, claustrophobic, and disturbing moments as he struggles to make his way to see his long-lost wife.

2 Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem

A Multi-Branch Story Far Ahead Of Its time

It's a shame that Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem ended up being such a commercial flop because it brought a ton of fresh ideas to the survival horror genre. Its attempts to break the fourth wall whenever the player ran out of sanity were quite innovative for the time, even if they hadn't aged well.

The game had its rough edges, with the combat sections being particularly woeful and a pain to sit through. However, players who forgave the minor faults of this title found themselves enjoying one of the most innovative survival horror games around where maintaining a high sanity meter was crucial to succeeding at the game's many challenges.

1 System Shock 2

A Genre-Defining Survival Horror

The amazing atmosphere of System Shock 2, coupled with its immersive sim, makes it arguably the best survival horror title of all time. There's a reason why SHODAN is one of the most iconic video game villains.

Controlling the unnamed hacker and exploring the desolate halls of the Von Braun makes for a harrowing time, with players looking over their shoulders every step of the way. The aggressive spawning of enemies means that players can't linger in areas for too long, which adds to the rampant tension.

item.title: 5 Olympic Athletes in Video Games
item.description:
Highlights

  • Olympic stars like Michael Phelps have transcended sports by appearing in their own video games, adding a new dimension to their iconic status.
  • From Usain Bolt in Pro Evolution Soccer to Roger Federer in Top Spin, Olympic athletes have made their mark in the video game world.
  • Even unexpected Olympians like pole vaulter Sergei Bubka and track star Carl Lewis have had their own video games, showcasing their talent in new ways.

The planet's greatest sporting event, the Olympics, is at the forefront of popular consciousness, with athletes from around the globe competing to cement their name as the best at their sporting disciplines. Whether viewers are into swimming or the occasional badminton match, the Olympics has something for everyone, iconizing athletes as sporting celebrities.

Throughout the game's history, notable sporting stars have gone beyond their Olympic achievements into entertainment by making guest appearances in video games. Several prominent sporting heroes have appeared in video games outside of Official Olympic Games titles, whether as themselves, new characters, or endorsements.

5 Michael Phelps

Pushing The Limit Of Swimming On The Xbox

Prominent Game

Michael Phelps: Push the Limit

Developer (s)

Blitz Games

Publisher (s)

505 Games

Genre

Sports

Platforms

Xbox 360

Legendary Olympic athlete Michael Phelps is known for being the most successful Olympian of all time, with a staggering 28 gold and numerous other medals to match. However, Phelps is less known for starring in his own video game titled Michael Phelps: Push the Limit.

A swimming simulation game at its heart, Push the Limit was released on the Xbox 360 in 2011. While not particularly popular among critics orfans, the game featured connectivity with the Xbox Kinect, allowing players to control Michael Phelps's swimming action through motion control. Though it was a novel feature at most, the realistic swimming gameplay of Push the Limit never quite hit the stardom of its Olympic namesake.

4 Usain Bolt

The Fastest PES Footballer Alive

Prominent Game

Pro Evolution Soccer 2018

Developer (s)

Konami

Publisher (s)

Konami

Genre

Sport

Platforms

PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PlayStation 4, Microsoft Windows, Xbox One, Mobile

While Phelps is the most successful Olympian, Usain Bolt is arguably the most iconic. Known for being the fastest man in history with a 100m sprint time of 9.58 seconds, Bolt is also fond of video games such as Mario Kart. The world's fastest man has also starred in a few gaming titles.

The popular indie sports game Bolt is one examplse, with player taking control of a miniature Usain Bolt, jumping over hurdles, and collecting items characteristic of endless runners. Similarly, the prolific runner also had a feature in the great coop sports game Pro Evolution Soccer 18, with football fanatics able to play 'the most beautiful game' as Bolt and compete against the world's best footballers.

3 Roger Federer

Gaming Tennis Royalty

Prominent Game

TopSpin 2K25

Developer(s)

Hangar 13

Publisher(s)

2K Games

Genre

Sport

Platforms

Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X and Series S, Xbox One

Roger Federer, the king of the court and now-retired tennis hero, is known for his stints at several Olympic Games throughout his career. Despite achievements in Olympic doubles (winning a gold medal), Federer never won a singles gold medal at the Olympics, losing to British player Andy Murray in the 2012 London Olympic Games.

Despite this, Roger Federer has been highly decorated inside and outside of tennis, especially in video games, with the tennis maestro featured in the best tennis games, such as Top Spin, Tennis World Tour, and Grand Slam series . Federer is the most prominent Olympic athlete in gaming.

2 Sergei Bubka

Famed Pole Vaulter With His Own Game

Prominent Game

Sergei Bubka's Millennium Games

Developer (s)

Dinamic Multimedia

Publisher (s)

Midas Interactive Entertainment

Genre

Sport

Platforms

PC

Famed Olympic and world champion pole vaulter Sergei Bubka has set numerous records as a prevalent force in pole jumping. The first athlete in history to achieve a vault of 6 meters in 1985, Sergei Bubka doesn't seem to be a ikely candidate to have his own video game. However, Bubka got prime time with Sergei Bubka's Millennium Games , released in 2000.

A mishmash of different track-based events, such as the 800m and 100m sprint, the game lets players take control of athletes, coaches, and national teams in competition across numerous events. While seemingly a knock-off of the Olympic Games video game series, Millennium Games is a capable sports game supported by Sergei Bubka in a bizarre but endearing entry to the sports video game genre.

1 Carl Lewi

Nostalgic Track And Field Gaming

Prominent Game

Carl Lewis Athletics 2000

Developer (s)

Planet Interactive

Publisher (s)

Ubisoft

Genre

Sport

Platforms

Game Boy Color

Considered one of the best track and field athletes of all time, Carl Lewis won nine gold medals across his decorated career in events such as the 100m and the long jump. A multidisciplinary athlete and an Olympic legend, Lewis was the namesake of video game titles such as The Carl Lewis Challenge, released on PC in 1992 and later Carl Lewis Athletics 2000 on the Game Boy Color.

Players could challenge an animated Carl Lewis across various track and field competitions, all in glorious 2D pixelated graphics. A great single-player sports game at the time, Carl Lewis Athletics 2000 , despite its age, is one of the best sports games an Olympian has endorsed.

item.title: Elden Ring: Madness Build Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Weapons and Seals for Madness Build
  • Best Frenzied Flame Incantations for Madness Builds
  • Best Armor for Madness Build
  • Best Talismans for Madness Builds
  • Best Class and Stats for Madness Build

Elden Ring features numerous status effects that can turn the tide of battle in your favor. Proccing bleed on an enemy removes a significant portion of their health, sleep renders an enemy vulnerable to attacks, and Scarlet Rot causes enemies to lose significant HP over time, among others. Most status effects are powerful and can trivialize boss fights. However, some, like Madness and Death Blight, have very niche uses and are effective primarily in PvP scenarios, and rarely in PvE.

While Death Blight only works against Tarnished enemies, Madness finds its purpose through its raw damage output rather than status build-up. Madness builds are generally avoided in PvE because most enemies are immune to the Madness effect. However, since Madness weapons and spells deal Fire damage, you can create a powerful Madness build in Elden Ring .

Follow this guide to learn about the best weapons, spells, armor, and stats for a Madness build in Elden Ring .

Best Weapons and Seals for Madness Build

Elden Ring has many powerful weapons with potent status effects, but in the case of Madness, the options are quite limited. Players who want a melee Madness build can obtain Vyke's War Spear by defeating Festering Fingerprint Vyke on the way to the Church of Inhibition in northeast Liurnia. As a great spear, this weapon has an excellent moveset, perfect for chasing down enemies in PvP or performing safe thrust attacks in PvE. In addition to its innate Madness build-up, Vyke’s War Spear has a powerful Ash of War that ignites the ground with the Flames of Frenzy.

Along with Vyke’s War Spear, you can also use the Fingerprint Stone Shield , one of the best shields in Elden Ring . This shield also comes with Madness build-up and has an offensive Ash of War called Shield Bash. Even without considering the Madness build-up, Vyke’s War Spear combined with the Fingerprint Stone Shield creates a strong shield poke build that works well in all scenarios.

The Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree DLC has added another melee option for fans of Madness - the Madding Hand . This fist weapon has a fast moveset that helps you build Madness rapidly on enemies vulnerable to it. Additionally, the Madding Hand gives a slight attack boost when Madness occurs nearby. While the weapon itself isn’t particularly impressive, it can be used to gain a little extra damage output.

In addition to Madness weapons, you’ll want to cast Frenzied Flame incantations, as they are the main stars of any Madness build. To ensure your incantations deal decent damage, the sacred seal you choose is crucial. Since all Madness incantations require Faith, the Erdtree Seal is the best Sacred Seal for a Madness build. If you plan to focus solely on spells, it’s also recommended to use the Frenzied Flame Seal in your off-hand for an extra damage bonus to Madness incantations.

Best Frenzied Flame Incantations for Madness Builds

Frenzied Flame is one of the most powerful spell classes in Elden Ring . Nearly all incantations belonging to Frenzied Flame are strong and effective. The only downside of using them is the Madness build-up on the caster. Here are the best Frenzied Flame incantations to include in a Madness build:

  • Howl of Shabriri : One of the best buffs in Elden Ring , Howl of Shabriri increases damage by 25% but causes you to take increased damage and attract enemy aggression. Since it’s a body buff, you can stack Howl of Shabriri with an aura buff like Golden Vow. This spell can be obtained from a chest atop the Frenzy-Flaming Tower in northeast Liurnia.
  • The Flame of Frenzy : Arguably the strongest Madness incantation, The Flame of Frenzy can be collected from Callu Baptismal Church in Weeping Peninsula without having to fight any enemies. It also has a low requirement of 16 Faith, allowing Prophet-class characters to cast it without leveling up. It can be charged and cast until the Madness effect triggers. With the right build, you’ll likely kill the enemy before Madness procs.
  • Frenzied Burst : The long-range attack of a Madness build. It shoots a beam of Frenzied Flame that can travel surprisingly long distances. Charging the spell will increase damage and cause the beam to travel faster. You’ll find this spell inside a scarab on the way to the Church of Inhibition.
  • Unendurable Frenzy : This is an endgame spell obtainable only after reaching the Consecrated Snowfield. It is found inside a chest located in Yelough Anix Ruins. Although it’s available late in the game, Unendurable Frenzy is outpowered by The Flame of Frenzy. The only advantage of using Unendurable Frenzy is that it can be cast continuously until you run out of FP or get inflicted with Madness.

Two Frenzied Flame spells were not mentioned in the list - Inescapable Frenzy and Midra’s Flame of Frenzy. Inescapable Frenzy is a lethal spell but only works against Tarnished enemies at a very close range. Even in PvP fights, landing Inescapable Frenzy on a player is nearly impossible. However, you can use it against PvE Tarnished enemies to easily cheese them.

As for Midra's Flame of Frenzy , it’s a DLC-exclusive spell available by exchanging the Remembrance of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. This spell requires two slots and has a higher Madness build-up compared to other Frenzied Flame incantations, and it is not a particularly powerful spell overall for its FP and spell slot cost. The Greatsword of Damnation is a much better choice than Midra’s Flame of Frenzy when exchanging the Rememberance of the Lord of Frenzied Flame.

Best Armor for Madness Build

When it comes to armor, most builds offer flexible options, allowing the wearer to choose their own fashion. However, Madness build enthusiasts need to be cautious when selecting an armor set, as you need high Focus to slow down Madness build-up. Here are some armor recommendations featuring high Focus stats:

  • Solitude Set (DLC exclusive) : This armor set is a reward for defeating the Blackgaol Knight found in the Western Nameless Mausoleum. You can obtain this armor set quite early in the DLC, as the Western Nameless Mausoleum is in Gravesite Plain near the start of SOTE .
  • Mushroom Set : While not the best armor set for poise, it has the highest Focus of all base game armors. You can get this set from the Seethewater Cave, located north of Seethewater River in Altus Plateau.
  • Fire Prelate Set : Easily one of the best armor sets in Elden Ring , the Fire Prelate Set boasts high poise, strong resistances to Fire and Physical attacks, and, most importantly, plenty of Focus points. This set is dropped by the Fire Prelate enemies in The Mountaintops of the Giants, and an Altered version of the chest armor can drop from the Fire Prelate inside Fort Laiedd in Mt. Gelmir.

Best Talismans for Madness Builds

There are many strong talismans to use in a Madness build in Elden Ring . Ideally, you want a mix of both offensive and defensive talismans to carry against mighty enemies. If you’re confident in your dodging skills, feel free to use only offensive talismans:

  • Shard of Alexander : This talisman is recommended for players using Vyke’s War Spear in their Madness build. Since you’ll be using this weapon’s Ash of War frequently, the extra damage from the Shard of Alexander makes a significant difference.
  • Fire Scorpion Charm : For any elemental build, equipping the respective Scorpion Charm talisman is essential. All Frenzied Flame incantations deal Fire damage, so having this talisman provides a 12% damage increase to Fire attacks in exchange for reduced damage negation.
  • Flock's Canvas Talisman : While you need to progress through Gowry’s questline to obtain Flock’s Canvas Talisman, it’s worth having for incantation builds. In Madness builds, your main source of damage comes from spells like The Flame of Frenzy and Frenzied Burst. This talisman boosts damage from all incantations by 8%.
  • Radagon Icon : One of the common issues with many incantations is their long animations. Fortunately, the Radagon Icon reduces spell casting time by providing virtual Dexterity points. Players who find Frenzied Flame incantations slow to cast will benefit from the Radagon Icon talisman.
  • Godfrey Icon : In a Madness build, The Flame of Frenzy and Frenzied Burst are the two most commonly used incantations. Both can be charged for extra damage, which can be further boosted by using the Godfrey Icon.
  • Clarifying Horn Charm : If you’re not using an armor set with a high Focus stat, the Clarifying Horn Charm talisman is a lifesaver. The +2 variant of this talisman increases Focus by 230, equivalent to the Focus provided by the best armor sets.
  • Aged One's Exultation : This talisman provides a simple 20% attack boost when Madness occurs nearby.

Best Class and Stats for Madness Build

Since all Frenzied Flame incantations require Faith, the Prophet starting class is the best choice for a Madness build in Elden Ring . This class starts with 16 Faith, which allows you to use The Flame of Frenzy spell immediately. As for the stats, your primary focus should be on increasing Faith to meet the requirements for all other Frenzied Flame incantations. However, make sure to also level up Vigor and Mind along the way. Here’s a level 125 Madness build recommendation using the Erdtree Seal along with Vyke’s War Spear:

  • Vigor: 40
  • Mind: 30
  • Endurance: 20
  • Strength: 16
  • Dexterity: 20
  • Intelligence: 7
  • Faith: 61
  • Arcane: 10

If you want to deal more damage with Vyke’s War Spear, invest points into Dexterity instead of Faith. For a spell-focused build, prioritize Faith, Mind, and Vigor.

Once you’ve completed your Madness build, you’ll need to decide on buffs for the build. Madness builds already have an excellent buff in Howl of Shabriri. You can stack it with Golden Vow, Aged One’s Exultation, and Black Dumpling headgear. As for the Flask of Wondrous Physick, the Fire Shrouding Cracked Tear is a must-have, and the second crystal tear can be either the Faith-Knot Crystal Tear, Speckled Hardtear, or Spiked Cracked Tear.

item.title: The 10 Best Action RPGs To Play If You Like The Witcher 3
item.description: There's no denying that The Witcher 3 is one of the best open-world, action RPGs out there. If you haven't gotten your fill just yet though, then we suggest taking a look at some of these games that are very similar in style.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Players Kill Time During Server Crash By Making a Massive Human Tower
item.description:
Highlights

  • Overwatch 2 players creatively pass time with a human tower during server downtime, showcasing teamwork in a unique and fun way.
  • Scheduled maintenance and updates cause periodic server outages, impacting play for those with unreliable connections.
  • Rare moments like the human tower unite players across teams, highlighting the sense of community that is present within Overwatch 2.

Two teams of Overwatch 2 players have decided to kill time during a server crash by making a massive human tower. Overwatch 2 has had multiple server downtimes since its release, but this may be the most memorable way players have spent an outage.

Due to its live service nature, Blizzard has to take Overwatch 2 offline for maintenance, content updates, and more. The ongoing requirement for players to have access to the internet may also affect gamers with an unreliable connection. While the community can expect such outages ahead of seasonal releases, the game is sometimes unintentionally inaccessible. Beyond these offline moments, the game may also run into hiccups that cause the game to crash for all players in a match. This typically results in a lobby where players can still freely move around, but cannot progress through a match. One set of players recently encountered a crash like this, and they spent the downtime making a massive human tower.

Reddit user Imjustabananaa recently shared an Overwatch 2 clip in which both teams in a match work together toward a common goal. According to the Reddit user, the server their match was on seemed to stop working, causing both teams to work together to create a human tower as they anticipated a resolution to their server woes. When the clip starts, D.Va, Doomfist, Pharah, Lifeweaver, Baptiste, Ashe, and a second Lifeweaver are all stacked on each other. The enemy Baptiste then uses his Exo Boots to reach the top of the tower before their allied Pharah is boosted up by Lifeweaver's Petal Platform. With Overwatch 2 's Pharah unable to stand on top of Baptiste, the human tower is completed by Echo who then aims the camera downward to highlight the tower from above.

These Overwatch 2 Players Formed a Human Tower

As Overwatch 2 features a 5v5 player-versus-player composition, the maximum height of this human tower is ten players. Given that Pharah never made it to the top of the tower before the video concluded, the human tower was capped at nine players. This video highlights one of the rare opportunities in which players on both sides work towards the same objective. Although Pharah inadvertently shot at Echo when trying to reach the top of the tower, none of them tried to defeat each other. While this type of thing could happen during a standard Overwatch 2 match, it's rare that both teams would remain so coordinated and friendly under normal circumstances.

Given that this experiment could've been ruined by one rogue player, it's impressive that the human tower was able to incorporate both teams. Most of the characters in the human tower have movement-based abilities that may have benefited their placement in it. Out of all these heroes, Overwatch 2 's Ashe likely had the hardest time reaching her position near the top of the stack.
